text: What is an example of non-diegetic sound in an interactive experience?
skills: Create interactive experiences by synthesizing audio experience design principles

options.feedback: Footsteps are an example of diegetic sound, which is sound that originates from within the world of the experience.

options.text: Wind blowing and other nature effects
options.feedback: Wind blowing and other nature effects are also examples of diegetic sound.
Character dialogue is another example of diegetic sound.
Background music is an example of non-diegetic sound, which is sound that does not originate from within the world of the experience. It is typically used to set the mood or atmosphere of a scene.

feedbackCorrect: Any audio that the viewer or player can hear, but that entities within the world of the experience can’t hear, is an example of non-diegetic audio. For example, background music that’s used to enhance the mood of a scene, but isn’t playing from an in-environment source such as a radio, is non-diegetic.
